content.description:
A fun route, marred only by a very hard pull about two-thirds up the route. This route would be a three star 5.10+ or 5.11- if it were a tad more consistent. Not bad if you have the crimp strength and definitely worth challenging yourself on if you liked its neighbor, The Real Special Forces.

Immediately right of The Real Special Forces.
15 bolts.

Most of the route is the same as Besieged, but instead of going left and up at the 7th bolt, it curves right to finish at the Siege Machine anchors. Serious pump by the end

Just to the left of the obvious route.
8 bolts, anchor at the top.

climbs.name: Captain Winkler
climbs.fa: Barely, Edwards, Barley and Winkler 1992, Revised by Rolf Rybak 2021

content.description:
Originally a poorly cleaned route with homemade rusty hangers, pins and non stainless hardware, it has now been rehabilitated into a modern 35 m classic sport climb. It saw less than half a dozen ascents in the last 20 years. What was a waste of real estate in a popular area is now a great addition.Â 

13 bolts. Requires a 70 m rope. With a 60 m rope, you'll have to lower/rap twice (via the Minor Skirmish anchor).


Begin as for Et Tu Brutus but continue directly up when ETB veers right.

13 bolts. Requires a 70 m rope. With a 60 m rope, you'll have to lower/rap twice (via the Minor Skirmish anchor).

This line is a squeeze job between Timorous to the climber's left and The Real Special Forces to the climber's right.  This is a decent line with a crux in the middle, and would be a minor classic if it was not so squeezed.

Between Timorous and The Real Special Forces.
12 bolts.

Start a bit left of Minor Skirmish with 3 bolts, then traverse right where Captain Winkler continues up and more left. It follows a shallow open book / groove, passing the anchor of Minor Skirmish, and finishing 50  meters up. Yes it's a long one. 
  
 Rap off of Special Forces in 2 raps

Start a bit left of Minor Skirmish.
5 bolts. Some small trad gear is useful.

Strange climb with a tough start and an odd move at the last bolt. Good overhanging moves to start then going into typical Skaha face climbing.

Starts on an overhang immediately to the right of Minor Skirmish.
6 bolts, chain anchors.

Move through two bolts to a thin, left-leaning dyke and eventually a layback flake. Reach the belay after moving right on a ramp. The second pitch is easier, but dirty, with a rap station above. 
  
 P1: 5.10a (25m) 
 P2: 5.9 (25m)

Same start as Special Forces, but continue left up the dyke. Shares anchors at top of 1st pitch with Special Forces too.
Mixed - 2 bolts and a range of gear.

The start provides a great stemming overhang to pull up into nice face climbing.

In a shady alcove, marked by the start in a corner with and overhang. The first bolt is quite high.
7 bolts, chain anchors.

A very thought provoking route with just classic technical sequences, just enough when you need it. Considered by many as one of Skaha's best at the grade.

The second bolt line to the left of the low roof marking the start of Mortal Combat, or the next line to the right of Timorous. The second bolt sits just above a horizontal grey streak of rock
10 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with chains.

Slopey jugs going up an overhang about 2/3 the way up is probably the crux. The rock is unusually different from other climbs in the area and is a pleasant change. Super fun bouldery sort of moves.

30 feet to the right of Minor Skirmish.
8 bolts - it was retro bolted to protect the start. Offset bolt anchors.

Part of the Fortress area. Gets sun first thing in the morning but shade in the early afternoon. Some of the routes listed in the older version of the guidebook as Sport+ have been retro bolted recently, and are described as such in the new guidebook.
